alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 5:28PM MST until December 13 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing drizzle and dense fog with visibilities as low as a hundred yards. Light ice accumulations. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, The Southern Front Range Foothills, and Castle Rock. * WHEN...Until noon MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Low visibilities will slow travel.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For current highway information, visit www.cotrip.org or call 5 1 1.
